javadoc:
A base class to hold duplicate information for commands that create 
 structures.  This class implements the logic of the 
 {@link #applyTo(DomainObject)} method so that child implementations need 
 only to implement the abstract methods.
@since Tracker Id 383

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Initializes the this class to create a structure with the given name 
 and address when the #applyTo(DomainObject) is called.

params.name: name
params.comment: The name of the structure to create.

methods.javadoc:
Applies this command to the given domain object.

This method is a Form Template method in that child subclasses do not need to override the method, but only need to implement the methods that this method calls. @param domainObject The domain object that is associated with this command @see Command#applyTo(DomainObject)
methods.name: applyTo
methods.comment:
Applies this command to the given domain object.
 
 This method is a Form Template method in that child subclasses do not
 need to override the method, but only need to implement the methods 
 that this method calls.

params.name: domainObject
params.comment:
The domain object that is associated with this
        command

methods.name: createStructure
methods.comment:
Child classes implement this method in order to create an instance
 of Structure.

throws.comment:
If the data at the given address is
         not valid for creating a structure.

return.comment:
A new StructureInfo object that describes the new structure to
         be created.

methods.javadoc:
Initializes the structure that is represented by the provided
 <tt>structureInfo</tt> object.  This involves populating the new 
 structure with data and then returning the data type object that 
 represents the newly created structure.
@param structureInfo The stucture info object that describes the newly
        created structure.
@return The new data type that represents the created structure.
methods.name: initializeStructureData
methods.comment:
Initializes the structure that is represented by the provided
 structureInfo object.  This involves populating the new 
 structure with data and then returning the data type object that 
 represents the newly created structure.

return.comment: The new data type that represents the created structure.

methods.javadoc:
Sets the new data type of this command.
@param dataType The new data type.
methods.name: setNewDataType
methods.comment: Sets the new data type of this command.

methods.javadoc:
Get the new structure data type which was created.
@return new structure.
methods.name: getNewDataType
methods.comment: Get the new structure data type which was created.

methods.javadoc:
Sets the value of the status message for this command
@param message The value of the command.
methods.name: setStatusMsg
methods.comment: Sets the value of the status message for this command

name: AbstractCreateStructureCmd
comment:
A base class to hold duplicate information for commands that create 
 structures.  This class implements the logic of the 
 #applyTo(DomainObject) method so that child implementations need 
 only to implement the abstract methods.
